comments.commentBody:
.
Well-stated! I put in the 'correct' entry because it fit, but I'm not going to use it as an answer if it ever comes up in a trivia contest.

Anglo-Saxon measuring systems also used body parts, most prominently the foot.

What is extremely clear that Loehmann, a policeman who was so sub-standard that he was forced out of his earlier job, shot Tamir Rice within two seconds of arriving at the scene.

Then his partner Garmback, instead of helping Tamir, bravely handcuffed Tamir's sister as she tried to rush to Tamir's aid.

Neither of these two 'policemen' tried to administer any kind aid to Tamir.

And yet you say that you can't draw any conclusions from the video footage!

No wonder the police get away with such shocking behaviour - there's an apologist hiding behind every tree.

It seems you would forgive the police anything. It is obvious that he is not point the "weapon" at anyone at the time he is shot and killed. People like you are why cops routinely get away with murder. If Tamir was your brother (I know, unlikely as he was black) you might feel differently.
Really. So even if not pointing the gun at the cops, the kid gets mowed down and by the way one caller did say he thought it was a toy.  That would be a toy.

Update...I didn't see the Times video footage when I originally posted.  It seems like more appropriate footage than what i saw on Youtube and, yet, I don't feel that i can draw conclusions about what happened (and didn't happen) from the footage.  One thing that is missing from the Times' footage is what appears to be Tamir, on several occasions, pointing a gun at pedestrians, which was noted by the police dispatcher.
Can you provide a link to video that has sound?  The footage I've seen has no sound and, therefore, no way to conclude whether the police tried to communicate with Tamir.
Love this cake and have made it twice now. Very easy and cooks nicely in a loaf pan. I have not tried the compote but sounds like it is with the effort.
For all the pts like this there are more that are decent. Why deprive all of the honest ones because of a few?

.
Because using "Chile" would show more respect for the solver?

ya, thats how law works, the police are not executioners.

INNOCENT until proven GUILTY means...
the that a police officer who kills an alleged criminal is GUILTY until proven innocent

Yet, a guy can walk into a theater armed to the teeth and kill 12 people in Colorado and some how he only gets ARRESTED... smh

And you guys do not see the problem here??
Four nuclear uses by the US, two in Japan, and the use of depleted uranium munitions (radioactive) multiple times in Serbia and Iraq.

The separatist rebellion was what first visited military force upon the region, and would not have survived without Russian intervention. Since the separatists started the armed rebellion, they are the aggressors. Further, there is no contradiction between Russia making nice noises in the UN and supporting the war; the purpose of the latter is to permanently shackle Ukraine with a frozen conflict.

Consider that neither Svoboda nor the Right Sektor have a presence in the government and are virtually non-existent in the Rada, "spearheaded by neo-Nazis" is grossly overblown.

Crimea was conquered by a Russia that used the fig leaf of a spurious referendum.  Ultimately, Yanukovich was responsible for his overthrow by the uprising of the Maidan, subsequently backed by the Rada.
The idea that these organizations could function without the imprimatur of the Russian government is untenable given the tight control Putin has over the country.
Hillary was always Republican light.  Liberal Democrats know that.

Strange approach to politics presented here (rice prichard? and other people with western names) shows clearly how deeply social engineering ingrained in Russian minds convictions about superiority of Russian politic and rights to shake of encirclement of Russia by all means available, be it distraction, duplicity or ... even war. As open conflict is not viable, they support clandestine operation of dismembering neighboring country, causing carnage and destruction, which would be inheritance of coming generations of Ukrainians.

From the article:

"The last three presidents — Bill Clinton, George W. Bush and Barack Obama — were all elected after promising to transcend partisanship. All failed in that aim after learning some hard lessons about how Washington actually works."

The only wishful thinking in the above sentences is that of Professor Nyhan's, who wishes that all of our politicians, Democrats, or Republicans, didn't have lie to us about things they already know. Not one of those men believed they were going to "change the way Washington, DC does business". Not one of them. And not one of them was unaware of how the game of politics was played in Washington, DC prior to getting elected, or they never would have been elected in the first place.

There was no learning curve involved here. There was the usual b.s. politicians always say to get elected. That is all. When we like the candidate, we give them the benefit of the doubt. When we don't like the candidate, we say they are lying to us. Two of my favorite Presidential lies are about "revamping the U.S. tax code" and "getting the waste and inefficiencies" out of the Federal government. Both are quadrennial favorites and neither get past first base after the President gets elected, or re-elected, as the case may be.

What we don't want to admit to ourselves is that we REQUIRE politicians to be dishonest with us. We like make-believe. My Dad can beat up your Dad. He can also revamp the U.S. tax code without bi-partisan support.

I was at a restaurant that offered pork schnitzel for a special Oktoberfest menu. They didn't say it was deep-fried.
So, so wrong. Always pan-fry, and the goal is always lightness, tenderness and a tender crisp bite. The ingredients may seem "heavy," but if done as directed here, you will have something sublime. If you don't have the pickles, just use the traditional lemon.
And, yes, the lingonberry is a great accompaniment.

Proper rest and proofing. Then just enough flour to take the stick off the surface. if it needs more, give it what it needs (kneeds)! I made mine in the food processor. Just a bit of slapping around to kneed after and rest.
Fridge gives smaller rising bubbles than room temp rising.

Made my first homemade pizza dough with this recipe for the first time a couple of months ago and now I'm making pizza every other week. Delicious! I do find that the dough is very sticky and can be much more delicate and thin than how it looks in the video. Any suggestions? I wonder about whether or not it is accurate enough. Regardless, the pizza turns out delicious!
I meant to say I wonder whether or not my home scale is accurate and that is why my dough is not turning out as it seems it should.

I, too, missed the wonder and beauty.  And frankly, for all the advances in special effects, the decades-old CGI of the original still seems more believable to me today than this state-of-the-art tech.  Because it's not a question of the tools at your disposal so much as a question of how you use them.

i agree.  i just rewatched the original Jurassic Park, and the wonder of the dinosaurs and their totally believable *aliveness* (possibly because some of the work was animatronic/puppets -- not just CGI) was moving and added to the terror that came later.  also, the characters may have had some stereotypes (the lawyer, the wheeler dealer park owner, the  greedy fat guy) but they had enough of their own humanity and character -- and relations of all sorts with the dinosaurs -- that they came across as believable as well.  i enjoyed 2 and 3, though the wonder of the first one *still* comes through 22 years later, as it never did again.

The first movie in this series had moments of wonder and beauty mixed in with those of terror and havoc.  Predictably the sequels have grown darker and more sanguinary as the carnivores have completely taken over.  What we've ended up with is yet another horror-film franchise not much different from Freddy and Jason but with much more expensive visual effects.  Is this really what you were aiming for, Steven?

I suggest you look to see State Department payments to various Ukrainian groups prior to Maidan - if you really want to learn how the US engineered the coup. The US usually uses an NGO it sets up to train demonstrators, supply them with printed material, and then when enough are trained to infiltrate them back into the country and start "democracy demonstrations" in the capital. This was the model we used in Belgrade against Milosevich. It is the model the State Department uses to "start peaceful democratic protests" which eventually turn violent.

Former CIA agent tells: How US infiltrates "civil society" to overthrow governments
http://www.informationclearinghouse.info/article4332.htm

http://www.veteranstoday.com/2015/03/30/ken-okeefe-goes-off-on-ngos-warf...
The USA is funding their army. Ukraine is more than broke.

Your assertions are correct. However there is going to have to be compromise and good faith on all sides if this imbroglio is to end soon and the deaths and destruction stop. Russia's cooperation on Iran, China, North Korea,Syria, etc. far outweigh the impasse in the Ukraine. The West and Russia need to "bury the hatchet" for the sake of stopping nuclear proliferation if nothing else. No sane person anywhere wants nuclear weapons in the hands of radical Islamists. Also the West needs to maintain a "hands off" policy on Russia and her "near abroad", the former constituent states of the old Soviet Union. Besides I think President Putin is extremely capable and can ably speak up and stand strong for Russia if and when real peace negotiations occur----hopefully soon.

Why am I starting to feel Twitter is sending its minions out to write one sentence praises? None of the pro Twitter remarks are anything more than "it'ssssssssssss Grrrreat!" without addressing the explicit problems others are indentifying?

Or are they trying to protect their bill of goods to sell to another dupe before it becomes obvious Teitter can never make a profit?
Twitter shouldn't be the only mean of sharing that info.

Agreed.  Twitter is a great place to go to for breaking news, either global, national, or local.  Tonight heading home from work, a live update from the Boston @MBTA saved me a lot of time by letting me know that my train was delayed by a breakdown.  Useful information, served up when I need it, and to the point. #twitterrocks!

Yeah, and American citizens started Maidan, now the Ukrainian Government is full of  fascists, corrupted oligarchs and  murders. , and people of Ukraine are suffering because of it. Glory to "Democratic" Ukraine?
I agree with swm. The way it's configured now, Twitter is simply another garbage media platform. merely another version of reality TV condensed into a 140 words.

I don't understand the running theme here about the supposed difficulty of using Twitter. it's very easy to use, and, while I'm here, I prefer Twitter over Facebook. Broadly put, Facebook is about keeping up with and showing off to friends. Twitter is about communicating with strangers. I prefer strangers over friends (again, as far as the use of Twitter v Facebook is concerned).

I consider myself computer savvy. I can fix any computer issue for you no matter how bad, and yet I cannot understand how to use Twitter. I have tried but simply can't get it. Many times I leave in frustration unable to find the information I am seeking.

I say the first thing the new boss needs to do is to come up with a simplified design so that dummies like me can use it. Until then there is not going to be any Facebook like growth.
